answerText: mitosis[10] The B type of this family of proteins helps drive the cell into mitosis. These proteins regulate the cell cycle by activating CDKs.

subject: Science
question: Question: The transition between two phases of this process is controlled by CDC20. For 10 points each: [10] Name this part of the cell cycle that sees the duplicated chromosomes partitioned into two groups. Generally this contains phases like prophase, metaphase, anaphase, and telophase.
